question: Match the following names and phrases with their correct descriptions based on the NCERT paragraph:
column_II: One of the most distinguished botanists
Born in this month and year
Specific field of Botany Maheshwari focused on
Felt satisfaction if student progresses ahead
matches: Panchanan Maheshwari–One of the most distinguished botanists
November 1904–Born in this month and year
Jaipur (Rajasthan)–Birthplace of a distinguished botanist
Allahabad–Obtained higher education here
D.Sc.–Degree achieved by Maheshwari
Dr W. Dudgeon–Inspired Maheshwari during college
American missionary teacher–Encouraged interest in Botany
Morphology–Specific field of Botany Maheshwari focused on
Teacher’s expression–Felt satisfaction if student progresses ahead
Student’s response–Encouraged Panchanan to enquire
answer: Panchanan Maheshwari–One of the most distinguished botanists, November 1904–Born in this month and year, Jaipur (Rajasthan)–Birthplace of a distinguished botanist, Allahabad–Obtained higher education here, D.Sc.–Degree achieved by Maheshwari, Dr W. Dudgeon–Inspired Maheshwari during college, American missionary teacher–Encouraged interest in Botany, Morphology–Specific field of Botany Maheshwari focused on, Teacher’s expression–Felt satisfaction if student progresses ahead, Student’s response–Encouraged Panchanan to enquire

question: Match the following contributions and terms with their correct descriptions from the NCERT paragraph:
column_I: Department of Botany, University of Delhi
column_II: Established as research centre in embryology
matches: Embryological characters–Popularised in taxonomy by Maheshwari
Department of Botany, University of Delhi–Established as research centre in embryology
Immature embryos–Artificial culture work initiated
Tissue culture–Landmark in science today
Test tube fertilisation–Won worldwide acclaim
Intra-ovarian pollination–Also won worldwide acclaim
Fellowship of Royal Society (FRS)–Honoured by this UK institution
Indian National Science Academy–Honoured by this Indian institution
First Biology textbooks–Contribution to school education
NCERT (1964)–Published for Higher Secondary Schools
answer: Embryological characters–Popularised in taxonomy by Maheshwari, Department of Botany, University of Delhi–Established as research centre in embryology, Immature embryos–Artificial culture work initiated, Tissue culture–Landmark in science today, Test tube fertilisation–Won worldwide acclaim, Intra-ovarian pollination–Also won worldwide acclaim, Fellowship of Royal Society (FRS)–Honoured by this UK institution, Indian National Science Academy–Honoured by this Indian institution, First Biology textbooks–Contribution to school education, NCERT (1964)–Published for Higher Secondary Schools
